title: Drawing, "Six capitals of columns, one of a pillar, with alternative suggestions", 1780–1800
title_raw: Six capitals of columns, one of a pillar, with alternative suggestions
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Three on each side in three rows: 1) in the center of the abacus the head of a wolf with wings of a bat. 2) At left, a volute, with a leaf mask; at right, half figure of a bird. In the center of the cornice a frog between leaves. At left a volute with a fantastic snake attacking the frog. At right, the half figure of a bird with a girl’s head. Row of upright leaves. 3) the pillar capital; in the center of the abacus is a bird’s head with wings supporting drapery festoons the opposite ends of which are supported at left by a winged dragon with a goat’s head and at right by an owl. The pillar is broken. 4) instead of the volutes at left, a rinceau with a lion’s head, and at right with a fish with a dog’s head. Both support a festoon hanging in front of flutes. 1-4: dark olive. 4) with half figures of owls at the corners and a woman’s mask in the center. 6) with a lion’s mask in the center of the abacus, a ram’s head at left, a girl’s head at right. In the center a dog’s head between crossed palm branches. 5 and 6 are brown, last two are in brown wash.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Six capitals of columns, one of a pillar, with alternative suggestions", 1780–1800. Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4617.
